intro: Neoachmandra samoensis, commonly known as the Samoan neoachmandra, is a flowering plant native to the islands of Samoa in the South Pacific. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical forests. Its botanical features include a woody stem, palmate leaves, and white or pale yellow flowers that bloom during the wet season. It is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
